meanings.definition: A brief summary or general survey of something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to write synopsises of their favorite books.
meanings.sent2: I always read the synopsises on the back of books before deciding to buy them.
meanings.sent3: The synopsises of the movies were so short, they made me laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a machine that constantly synopsises information.
meanings.sent5: The synopsises of the stories were like little sneak peeks into the plots.

meanings.definition: To make a summary of something.
meanings.sent1: She synopsises the main points of the article in her presentation.
meanings.sent2: He always synopsises the key details of the meeting for his team.
meanings.sent3: The way he synopsises information is both efficient and effective.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to synopsises complex ideas is truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: He synopsises the events of the day in his journal every night.
